verses.verse: Now<WG1161> He was telling<WG3004> them a parable<WG3850> to show that at all<WG3842> times<WG3842> they ought<WG1163> to pray<WG4336> and not to lose<WG7051> heart,<WG7051>
saying,<WG3004> "There was in a certain<WG5100> city<WG4172> a judge<WG2923> who did not fear<WG5399> God,<WG2316> and did not respect<WG1788> man.<WG444>
"And there was a widow<WG5503> in that city,<WG4172> and she kept coming<WG2064> to him, saying,<WG3004> 'Give<WG1556> me legal<WG1556> protection<WG1556> from my opponent.<WG476>'

"And for a while<WG5550> he was unwilling<WG3756>;<WG2309> but afterward<WG3326> <WG3778> he said<WG3004> to himself,<WG1438> 'Even<WG2532> though<WG1487> I do not fear<WG5399> God<WG2316> nor<WG3761> respect<WG1788> man,<WG444>

yet<WG1065> because<WG1223> this<WG3778> widow<WG5503> bothers<WG3930> <WG2873> me, I will give<WG1556> her legal<WG1556> protection,<WG1556> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> by continually<WG1519> <WG5056> coming<WG2064> she wear<WG5299> me out.' "
And the Lord<WG2962> said,<WG3004> "Hear<WG191> what<WG5101> the unrighteous<WG93> judge<WG2923> said;<WG3004>

now<WG1161> shall not God<WG2316> bring<WG4160> about<WG4160> justice<WG1557> for His elect,<WG1588> who cry<WG994> to Him day<WG2250> and night,<WG3571> and will He delay<WG3114> long<WG3114> over<WG1909> them?

"I tell<WG3004> you that He will bring<WG4160> about<WG4160> justice<WG1557> for them speedily.<WG5034> However,<WG4133> when the Son<WG5207> of Man<WG444> comes,<WG2064> will He find<WG2147> faith<WG4102> on the earth<WG1093>?"

And He also<WG2532> told<WG3004> this<WG3778> parable<WG3850> to certain<WG5100> ones<WG5100> who trusted<WG3982> in themselves<WG1438> that they were righteous,<WG1342> and viewed<WG1848> others<WG3062> with contempt: <WG1848>
"Two<WG1417> men<WG444> went<WG305> up into the temple<WG2413> to pray,<WG4336> one<WG1520> a Pharisee,<WG5330> and the other<WG2087> a tax-gatherer.

"The Pharisee<WG5330> stood<WG2476> and was praying<WG4336> thus<WG3778> to himself,<WG1438> 'God,<WG2316> I thank<WG2168> Thee that I am<WG1510> not like<WG5618> other<WG3062> people:<WG3062> swindlers,<WG727> unjust,<WG94> adulterers,<WG3432> or<WG2228> even<WG2532> like<WG5613> this<WG3778> tax-gatherer.
'I fast<WG3522> twice<WG1364> a week;<WG4521> I pay<WG7503> tithes<WG7503> of all<WG3956> that I get.<WG2932>'

"But the tax-gatherer, standing<WG2476> some<WG3113> distance<WG3113> away,<WG3113> was even<WG3761> unwilling<WG3756> <WG2309> to lift<WG1869> up his eyes<WG3788> to heaven,<WG3772> but was beating<WG5180> his breast,<WG4738> saying,<WG3004> 'God,<WG2316> be merciful<WG2433> to me, the sinner!<WG268>'

"I tell<WG3004> you, this<WG3778> man<WG3778> went<WG2597> down<WG2597> to his house<WG3624> justified<WG1344> rather<WG3844> than<WG3844> the other;<WG1565> for everyone<WG3956> who exalts<WG5312> himself<WG1438> shall be humbled,<WG5013> but he who humbles<WG5013> himself<WG1438> shall be exalted.<WG5312>"
And they were bringing<WG4374> even<WG2532> their babies<WG1025> to Him so<WG2443> that He might touch<WG681> them, but when the disciples<WG3101> saw<WG3708> it, they [began] rebuking<WG2008> them.

But Jesus<WG2424> called<WG4341> for them, saying,<WG3004> "Permit<WG863> the children<WG3813> to come<WG2064> to Me, and do not hinder<WG2967> them, for the kingdom<WG932> of God<WG2316> belongs<WG1510> to such<WG5108> as these.<WG5108>
"Truly<WG281> I say<WG3004> to you, whoever<WG3739> <WG302> does not receive<WG1209> the kingdom<WG932> of God<WG2316> like<WG5613> a child<WG3813> shall not enter<WG1525> it [at all.]"
And a certain<WG5100> ruler<WG758> questioned<WG1905> Him, saying,<WG3004> "Good<WG18> Teacher,<WG1320> what<WG5101> shall I do<WG4160> to inherit<WG2816> eternal<WG166> life<WG2222>?"
And Jesus<WG2424> said<WG3004> to him, "Why<WG5101> do you call<WG3004> Me good<WG18>? No<WG3762> one<WG3762> is good<WG18> except<WG1508> God<WG2316> alone.<WG1520>

"You know<WG3609> the commandments,<WG1785> 'Do not commit<WG3431> adultery,<WG3431> Do not murder,<WG5407> Do not steal,<WG2813> Do not bear<WG5576> false<WG5576> witness,<WG5576> Honor<WG5091> your father<WG3962> and mother.<WG3384>'"
And he said,<WG3004> "All<WG3956> these<WG3778> things<WG3778> I have kept<WG5442> from [my] youth.<WG3503>"

And when Jesus<WG2424> heard<WG191> [this,] He said<WG3004> to him, "One<WG1520> thing<WG1520> you still<WG2089> lack;<WG3007> sell<WG4453> all<WG3956> that you possess,<WG2192> and distribute<WG1239> it to the poor,<WG4434> and you shall have<WG2192> treasure<WG2344> in heaven;<WG3772> and come,<WG1204> follow<WG190> Me."
But when he had heard<WG191> these<WG3778> things,<WG3778> he became<WG1096> very<WG4036> sad;<WG4036> for he was extremely<WG4970> rich.<WG4145>
And Jesus<WG2424> looked<WG3708> at him and said,<WG3004> "How<WG4459> hard<WG1423> it is for those<WG3588> who are wealthy<WG5536> to enter<WG1531> the kingdom<WG932> of God!<WG2316>

"For it is easier<WG2123> for a camel<WG2574> to go<WG1525> through<WG1223> the eye<WG5144> of a needle,<WG7027> than<WG2228> for a rich<WG4145> man<WG4145> to enter<WG1525> the kingdom<WG932> of God.<WG2316>"
And they who heard<WG191> it said,<WG3004> "Then<WG2532> who<WG5101> can<WG1410> be saved<WG4982>?"
But He said,<WG3004> "The things<WG102> impossible<WG102> with men<WG444> are possible<WG1415> with God.<WG2316>"
And Peter<WG4074> said,<WG3004> "Behold,<WG2400> we have left<WG863> our own<WG2398> [homes,] and followed<WG190> You."

And He said<WG3004> to them, "Truly<WG281> I say<WG3004> to you, there is no<WG3762> one<WG3762> who<WG3739> has left<WG863> house<WG3614> or<WG2228> wife<WG1135> or<WG2228> brothers<WG80> or<WG2228> parents<WG1118> or<WG2228> children,<WG5043> for the sake<WG1752> of the kingdom<WG932> of God,<WG2316>
who<WG3739> shall not receive<WG2983> many<WG4179> times<WG4179> as much<WG4179> at this<WG3778> time<WG2540> and in the age<WG165> to come,<WG2064> eternal<WG166> life.<WG2222> "

And He took<WG3880> the twelve<WG1427> aside<WG3880> and said<WG3004> to them, "Behold,<WG2400> we are going<WG305> up to Jerusalem,<WG2419> and all<WG3956> things<WG3956> which are written<WG1125> through<WG1223> the prophets<WG4396> about the Son<WG5207> of Man<WG444> will be accomplished.<WG5055>
"For He will be delivered<WG3860> to the Gentiles,<WG1484> and will be mocked<WG1702> and mistreated<WG5195> and spit<WG1716> upon,
and after they have scourged<WG3146> Him, they will kill<WG615> Him; and the third<WG5154> day<WG2250> He will rise<WG450> again.<WG450> "

And they understood<WG4920> none<WG3762> of these<WG3778> things,<WG3778> and this<WG3778> saying<WG4487> was hidden<WG2928> from them, and they did not comprehend<WG1097> the things that were said.<WG3004>
And it came<WG1096> about that as He was approaching<WG1448> Jericho,<WG2410> a certain<WG5100> blind<WG5185> man<WG5185> was sitting<WG2521> by the road,<WG3598> begging.<WG1871>
Now<WG1161> hearing<WG191> a multitude<WG3793> going<WG1279> by, he [began] to inquire<WG4441> what<WG5101> this<WG3778> might be.
And they told<WG518> him that Jesus<WG2424> of Nazareth<WG3480> was passing<WG3928> by.
And he called<WG994> out, saying,<WG3004> "Jesus,<WG2424> Son<WG5207> of David,<WG7035> have<WG1653> mercy<WG1653> on me!"

And those<WG3588> who led<WG4254> the way<WG4254> were sternly<WG2008> telling<WG2008> him to be quiet;<WG4601> but he kept crying<WG2905> out all<WG4183> the more,<WG3123> "Son<WG5207> of David,<WG7035> have<WG1653> mercy<WG1653> on me!"
And Jesus<WG2424> stopped<WG2476> and commanded<WG2753> that he be brought<WG71> to Him; and when he had come<WG1448> near,<WG1448> He questioned<WG1905> him,
"What<WG5101> do you want<WG2309> Me to do<WG4160> for you?" And he said,<WG3004> "Lord,<WG2962> [I want] to regain<WG308> my sight!<WG308>"
And Jesus<WG2424> said<WG3004> to him, "Receive<WG308> your sight;<WG308> your faith<WG4102> has made<WG4982> you well.<WG4982>"

And immediately<WG3916> he regained<WG308> his sight,<WG308> and [began] following<WG190> Him, glorifying<WG1392> God;<WG2316> and when all<WG3956> the people<WG2992> saw<WG3708> it, they gave<WG1325> praise<WG136> to God.<WG2316>
